1.name: Razzaq Mouhamed
1.text: I never imagined rabbit farming could be this rewarding until I partnered with Kigali Rabbit Center. Their expertise, high-quality breeds, and ongoing support have transformed my small farm into a thriving business. I'm forever grateful!

2.name: Pauline
2.text: Kigali Rabbit Center changed the way I farm. I received healthy rabbits and expert advice that helped me scale from a small backyard project to a full rabbitry. Their team genuinely cares about farmers.

3.name: Claudine
3.text: The educational tour at Kigali Rabbit Center was amazing! My children learned so much about animal care and sustainable farming. It‚Äôs a must-visit spot for schools and families.

4.name: Samuel
4.text: Their training program gave me the confidence to start my own rabbit farm. It was practical, hands-on, and perfectly suited for beginners like me. Thank you, KRC!

farming.title: RABBIT FARMING
farming.subtitle: A Sustainable and Profitable Venture
farming.content1: Rabbit farming is a lucrative and sustainable agricultural practice that has gained popularity in recent years. At KIGALI RABBIT CENTER, we are dedicated to promoting and supporting rabbit farming as a viable business opportunity for farmers in Rwanda and across Africa.
farming.content2: Rabbits are known for their high reproductive rate, efficient feed conversion, and ability to thrive in various environments. This makes them ideal livestock for small-scale farmers looking to increase income. Additionally, rabbit meat is lean, high in protein, and in demand in the market.
farming.content3: Our team at KIGALI RABBIT CENTER offers training and consultancy to help farmers with breeding, feeding, disease management, and marketing.
farming.highlight: Join us at KIGALI RABBIT CENTER and embark on a journey toward a more sustainable and profitable future in agriculture through rabbit farming.

why.title: Why Choose Kigali Rabbit Center?

items.question: Why Rabbit farming?
items.answer: The domestic rabbit, Oryctolagus cuniculus, is a descendant of wild rabbits of southern Europe and North Africa. Rabbits are ideal small livestock for peri-urban or rural areas, especially in developing countries. Rabbits produce lean white meat high in protein, low in fat and cholesterol. Their skins are also used in garments and crafts. In 2020, world production of rabbit meat was estimated at 1.8 million tons annually. Top producers include Italy, France, China.

items.question: Advantages of keeping rabbits:
answer: Low cost for animals and housing
Can give birth to 25+ offspring per year
Short fattening period, market-ready in 8 weeks
Highly nutritious meat, over 300 recipe variations
Low land requirements and low upkeep costs

1.title: Raising giant rabbits, some weighing 10 Kgs üê∞üêá
1.excerpt: It may sound surprising, but it's real, and it's happening right here in Rwanda! Meet Dieudonn√© Musoni, a visionary Rwandan entrepreneur and CEO of Kigali Rabbit Center.
content: Rabbit farming has become an increasingly popular agricultural activity in Rwanda, offering both nutritional and economic benefits to farmers.
Traditional rabbit farming methods are being replaced with more efficient, sustainable practices that increase productivity while ensuring animal welfare.
These methods include improved housing designs, better breeding techniques, and optimized feeding programs.

2.title: Sustainable Practices for Small Farms
2.excerpt: Learn how to implement eco-friendly methods in your farming operations
content: Sustainable rabbit farming focuses on environmentally friendly practices that maintain ecosystem balance.
Key practices include proper waste management, renewable resource use, and natural feeding methods.
These approaches not only benefit the environment but also improve the quality of your rabbit products.
